page.title: 02Stetchworth
page.content: Stetchworth is a typical English village.It is set in delightful countryside surrounded by farmland and studs and has several woodland walks.The village is situated near the racing town of Newmarket and the Devil's Dyke. The new Ellesmere Centre has sports facilities and a Community Shop.The Centre is designed to serve the six neighbouring parishes and took two years to build.There are two studs in the village,called Collin Stud and Stetchworth Park Stud.There is a British Legion Club and a village pub called The Marquis of Granby. The parish church is called St.Peter's.The houses are some council houses,quite a few new estate houses and a few very old houses.There is a Police House,empty at present,a Post Office and a Primary School. The population is about 600.
